article:
{{Infobox family name
| name = Meyers
|image= |imagesize= |caption=
| pronunciation = meaning ="magistrate", "physician", "marsh" region = origin
| =England related names =Myers, Myars, Miares, Myeres footnotes =
}} 'Meyers', a variant surname spelling of Myers, is of both English and German
surname origin. The German surname refers to a town magistrate. The English
surname may mean "physician" (from "mire", Old French, or "marsh" (from "myrr",
Old Norse}. There are many variant spellings. People with the
surname include:

* Albert I. Meyers (1932â2007), American organic chemist, professor at Colorado
  State University
* Ann Meyers (born 1955), former American basketball player and current
  sportscaster
* Ari Meyers (born 1969), American actress, best known from the television
  series Kate & Allie
* Brad Meyers (born 1980), Australian National Rugby League player
* Bruce F. Meyers, American car designer and entrepreneur, best known for the
  Meyers Manx dune buggy
* Charles M. Meyers, park keeper and early designer of Washington Park in
  Portland, Oregon
* Charley Meyers, one of the founders of Weaver Aircraft Company of Ohio
* Chief Meyers (1880â1971), Major League Baseball catcher from 1909 to 1917
* Dave Meyers, American music video director
* FranÃ§oise Meyers, granddaughter of EugÃ¨ne Schueller and member of the L'OrÃ©al

* Gerald C. Meyers, American industrialist, former Chairman of American Motors
  Corporation
* Glenford J. Myers, computer scientist, an author of a number of books.
* Jerry Meyers (born 1965), head baseball coach at Old Dominion University,
  2004âpresent
* Joel Meyers, American sportscaster, current play-by-play announcer for the Los

  American sketch comedy show MADtv
* Krystal Meyers (born 1988), American Christian rock musician
* Marilyn Meyers, ChargÃ© d'Affaires ad interim to Burma from September 1994 -

* Myer Myers, Jewish American Siversmith 1723 -1795
* Mike Meyers (baseball) (born 1977), Canadian professional baseball player
* Nancy Meyers (born 1949), American film director, producer, and screenwriter
* Scott Meyers, American author of several books on object oriented programming
* Seth Meyers (born 1973), American actor and comedian, cast member of Saturday
  Night Live
* Sidney Meyers (1906â1969), American film director and editor
* William M. Colmer (middle name, Meyers) (1890â1980), Mississippi politician
* Captain W. J. Meyers (?-1925), captain of the SS ''Cotopaxi'' when it

* John Meyers, better known as Johnny Weaver, professional wrestler and
